metadata.Title: CVE-2018-16435 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Little CMS (aka Little Color Management System) 2.9 has an integer overflowin the AllocateDataSet function in cmscgats.c, leading to a heap-basedbuffer overflow in the SetData function via a crafted file in the secondargument to cmsIT8LoadFromFile.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-16435` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

liblcms2-2 - 2.5-0ubuntu4.2
liblcms2-utils - 2.5-0ubuntu4.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: chromium-browser: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
oxide-qt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
lcms2 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.5-0ubuntu4.2').
lcms: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
